result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary K Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Expunction will be granted by the court if all court obligations, supervision fees and restitution are paid in full and upon defendant's successful completion of probation or sentence.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

timeConds.notes:
Court grants 1 day jail credit to be applied to the conditional jail sentence.
Court grants work release. 
Must report to jail today, May 29, 2015 by 9:00 AM.

Defendant Zachary K Thompson in court with attorney Owen R. Williams.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State relates joint agreement.  Amended Information presented.
State moves to amend Count 1 to 961.41 (3g)(e) Possession of THC Party to a Crime.  Court grants amendment.
State moves to amend Count 2 to 961.41 (3g)(e) Possession of THC Party to a Crime.  Court grants amendment.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented.  Court questions defendant.  Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1 as amended, Count 2 as amended, and Count 3.  Court accepts and finds Guilty on all  3 Counts.
State relates.  Attorney Williams relates.  
Defendant addresses Court.

Court relates and orders: Withheld Sentence.
Count 1:
Probation: 2 years.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.  
Must not possess or consume controlled substances or drug paraphernalia. 
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Jail: 45 days with 1 day credit - with work release.
Court Costs.

Count 2 and Count 3: All probation conditions as Count 1.  No jail on these counts.

Expunction will be granted by the court if all court obligations, supervision fees and restitution are paid in full and upon defendant's successful completion of probation or sentence.

Defendant to report to jail today by 9:00 a.m.
